title.en: Synthetic Biology and Industrial Cell Factories

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

course_main_structural_unit.address:
Nooruse 1
50411 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
General topics: fermentation technologies, sustainable bioprocessing, bioprocessing for industrial production of chemicals, fuels and proteins; gas fermentation technologies, synthetic biology solutions for reaching biosustainability goals, biomass as a local resource, wood chemistry.
The course also provides insight into the contemporary use of synthetic biology tools for cell factories based on prokaryotic and eukaryotic organisms (bacteria, yeast, CHO cells, insect cells, algae, plants) in e.g. food, chemical and pharmaceutical industries. Manifold opportunities of anaerobic and aerobic production of biological compounds (metabolites, proteins, polymers, etc.) will be discussed and the major producing organisms and the technologies underlying their use and exploitation will be introduced. Also alternative methods for production of bio-based chemicals will be discussed (green chemistry).

objectives.en: The aim is students to acquire knowledge of industrial applications of synthetic biology. The focus is given to pathways leading to anaerobic and aerobic production of industrially relevant compounds.

independent_work.et: Reading the lecture notes and written materials. Preparation for the exam

description.et: exam will cover the whole content of the course and the student will be evaluated based on his/her knowledge of that content, 60p

grade_evaluation.et:
Final report
Report will summarise practical course work in a research article-type format. Submitting report by second exam start time - max 40p; by resit exam start time max 30p.

Oral exam
Oral exam will cover the whole content of the course and the student will be evaluated based on his/her knowledge of that content, max 60p

debt_elimination.et: two regular exams and one retake

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: lecture slides, course material together with additional literature is expected to be studied following every lecture.
resources.recommended_materials: "Synthetic Biology, A primer." Baldwin et al. Imperial College Press (2016)
